question: Coverage options for military veterans
text:
Coverage options for military veterans
          
        
If you're a veteran without VA healthcare, visit the 
VA health care website
. You may learn that you qualify for VA coverage.
If you don't have veterans coverage


If you're a veteran who 
isn't
 enrolled in VA benefits or other veterans health coverage, or have coverage through another program like Medicaid (Medical Assistance or MA) you can get coverage through Pennie.


Depending on your household size and income, you may be able to get lower costs on monthly premiums and out-of-pocket costs on private insurance. You also might qualify for free or low-cost coverage through Medicaid orCHIP.


If your dependents aren't covered


If you're a veteran enrolled in (or are a beneficiary of) a VA health care program, you may have dependents who aren't eligible for a VA health care program. They can get coverage through Pennie.


Depending on household size and income, they may get lower costs on monthly premiums or out-of-pocket costs. Or they could be eligible for free or low-cost coverage through MA orCHIP.


Note:
 TRICARE's 
young adult coverage option
 is different from the Affordable Care Act's under-26 rules. Make sure you understand how qualifying ages, benefits, and other details differ.
